item.title: Using Python and R
item.description: Python and R languages in R Studio! Over the course of the semester, I have developed skills in both R and Python and am now able to have them both communicate in R Studio. Using R language to evaluate the ‘iris’ dataset Below, I show how one can use R to evaluate a dataset, in this case the ‘iris’ dataset, and use the data to form meaningful plots. # Scatterplot of 'iris' dataset comparing petal width to petal length by species library(ggplot2) iris <- iris ggplot(iris, aes(x=Petal.

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Data Wrangling and Exploration Introduction The data that I acquired for this project was found on the University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute’s website, where I honed in on county health rankings. Because I intend on going to medical school and eventually becoming a doctor, I found health data to be of particular interest. More than this, however, I am passionate about educating myself on health disparities seen across different groups in our countries.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: This dataset, obtained through the ‘fivethirtyeight’ database, outlines each case of police killings in the United States during the year of 2015. The variables I chose to include are particular to each victim of said police killings: age, race/ethnicity, armed (whether or not they possessed a weapon at the time of their murder), the percentage of the population that was white, black or hispanic/latino in the area that the shooting took place, median household income of the area, poverty rates of the area, and proportion of college graduates in the area.
